title: Does "Pause App" stop the app from running in the background? Or does it simply hide notifications?
content: I tend to uninstall apps that I infrequently use so they're not running in background, using resources (CPU, RAM, battery).  I'd rather simply "pause" them, if the built-in "Pause App" function truly pauses the app/service.  Does it do that, or does it simply prevent the notifications from appearing?
